section.title: The Passive
section.sectiontitle: The Passive can be used for 'distancing'. This means that the speaker/writer doesn't want the whole responsibility for the ideas (s)he expresses. The passive is often used to make a statement less personal and more polite.
section.text1a: That isn't allowed. (It isn't the speaker's decision; it is an impersonal rule).
section.text2: You must hand in the essay by Friday.
section.text2a: The essay must be handed in by Friday.
section.sectiontitle2: The Passive is used in formal writing when the focus is on achievements and events rather than the people who were responsible.
section.text4a: The new law was passed in April.

section.title: The Passive
section.sectiontitle: There are some common passive expressions to show that we are not certain of a statement.
section.text1a: It is believed that the thief was an ex-employee.
section.text2a: It is said that he was able to speak more than twenty languages.
